  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.dylon.liblevenshtein.levenshtein.factory.TransducerBuilder
  • All Implemented Interfaces:

    public class TransducerBuilder
extends Object
implements ITransducerBuilder, Serializable
    Fluently-builds Levenshtein transducers.

      • dictionary

        public ITransducerBuilder dictionary(@NonNull
                                     Collection<String> dictionary)
        Specifies the collection of dictionary terms for the dictionary automaton. This method assumes the collection is not sorted.
        Specified by:
        dictionary in interface ITransducerBuilder
        Parameters:
        dictionary - Collection of dictionary terms to consider when generating spelling candidates.
        Returns:
        This ITransducerBuilder or an equivalent one, for fluency.

      • dictionary

        public ITransducerBuilder dictionary(@NonNull
                                     Collection<String> dictionary,
                                     boolean isSorted)
        Specifies the collection of dictionary terms for the dictionary automaton.
        Specified by:
        dictionary in interface ITransducerBuilder
        Parameters:
        dictionary - Collection of dictionary terms to consider when generating spelling candidates.
        isSorted - Whether the dictionary is sorted. If it is not sorted then it will probably be sorted.
        Returns:
        This ITransducerBuilder or an equivalent one, for fluency.

      • build

        public <CandidateType> ITransducer<CandidateType> build()
        Builds a Levenshtein transducer according to the parameters set for this ITransducerBuilder.
        Specified by:
        build in interface ITransducerBuilder
        Type Parameters:
        CandidateType - Implicit type of the spelling candidates generated by the transducer.
        Returns:
        Levenshtein transducer for seeking spelling candidates for query terms (fuzzy searching!).

      • maxCandidates

        @Deprecated
 @Generated(value="lombok")
public TransducerBuilder maxCandidates(int maxCandidates)
        Deprecated. 

        WARNING This parameter has been deprecated and is schemduled for removal in the next major release. Rather than specifying it here, take maxCandidates number of elements from the ICandidateCollection returned from the transducer.

        If desired, the maximum number of elements in the collections of spelling candidates.

        Specified by:
        maxCandidates in interface ITransducerBuilder
        Parameters:
        maxCandidates - If desired, the maximum number of elements in the collections of spelling candidates.
        Returns:
        This TransducerBuilder for fluency.
